info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 07 at 8:27PM EST until March 07 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... Southeastern Washington County in east central New York... Northern Rensselaer County in east central New York... Bennington County in southern Vermont... West central Windham County in southern Vermont... * Until 900 PM EST. * At 826 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hoosick Falls, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Troy, Bennington, North Adams, Hoosick Falls, Arlington, Stratton, Williamstown, Shaftsbury, Pownal, Green Island, Grafton, Berlin, Cambridge, Stamford, New Ashford, Center Brunswick, Wyantskill, Wynantskill, West Wardsboro and Brunswick. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
